      • controlVAppOptimistic

        public void controlVAppOptimistic(ControlModule.ControlAction action,
                         com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vdc vdc,
                         com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vapp vapp)
                           throws com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.VCloudException,
                                  ControlException
        Executes the relevant control command based on the desired action.

        : There are a number of checks to make to see whether the vApp is in a stable state to service the control action request. There are three main factors here:-

        1) The current status of the vApp and whether the control command is to put the vApp into this state.
        2) Whether he control action requested is available to perform on the vApp.
        3) If the action is determined to be appropriate and available, is a know VCloudException thrown from the vCloud Client method call?

        Depending on the outcome of the first two factors, the action may or may not be carried out. The calling process will either receive a standard void return from the method, indicating that it has completed, or an Exception of the appropriate type will be thrown to advise the calling process of what went wrong.

        NB - if we have gotten this far, it means the calling process was able to resolve the vApp dependency, so it is guaranteed to exist.
        Parameters:
        start -
        vdc -
        vapp -
        Throws:
        com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.VCloudException
        ControlException

      • controlVM

        @RetryOnFailure(attempts=20,

      • controlVMOptimistic

        @RetryOnFailure(attempts=20,
                delay=30L,
                unit=SECONDS,
                types=VmBusyException.class,
                randomize=false)
public void controlVMOptimistic(ControlModule.ControlAction action,
                                                                  com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vdc vdc,
                                                                  com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vapp vapp,
                                                                  String vmName)
                         throws com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.VCloudException,
                                ControlException,
                                VmBusyException
        Executes the relevant control command based on the desired action.

        : There are a number of checks to make to see whether the VM is in a stable state to service the control action request. There are three main factors here:-

        1) The current status of the vApp and whether the control command is to put the VM into this state.
        2) Whether he control action requested is available to perform on the VM.
        3) If the action is determined to be appropriate and available, is a know VCloudException thrown from the vCloud Client method call?

        Depending on the outcome of the first two factors, the action may or may not be carried out. The calling process will either receive a standard void return from the method, indicating that it has completed, or an Exception of the appropriate type will be thrown to advise the calling process of what went wrong.

      • isVappActionValid

        private Boolean isVappActionValid(ControlModule.ControlAction action,
                        com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vapp vApp)
        - Control command error handling.

        We will examine the currently available actions that the retrieved vApp is reporting it is able to perform. If our chosen ControlAction is among them, we let the calling process know this.
        Parameters:
        action -
        vApp -
        Returns:

      • determineStateOfVapp

        private ControlModule.ControlStatus determineStateOfVapp(ControlModule.ControlAction action,
                                               com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vapp vApp)
                                                  throws ControlException
        - Control command error handling.

        Method to determine whether the vApp is in a state that should be able to process control command requests.

        vApp statuses are as below:

        FAILED_CREATION(-1) (unstable) - Transient entity state, e.g., model object is created but the corresponding VC backing does not exist yet. This is further sub-categorized in the respective entities.
        UNRESOLVED(0) (unstable) - Entity is whole, e.g., VM creation is complete and all the required model objects and VC backings are created.
        RESOLVED(1) - Entity is resolved.
        DEPLOYED(2) - Entity is deployed.
        SUSPENDED(3) - All VMs of the vApp are suspended.
        POWERED_ON(4) - All VMs of the vApp are powered on.
        WAITING_FOR_INPUT(5) (unstable) - VM is pending response on a question.
        UNKNOWN(6) (unstable) - Entity state could not be retrieved from the inventory, e.g., VM power state is null.
        UNRECOGNIZED(7) (unstable) - Entity state was retrieved from the inventory but could not be mapped to an internal state.
        POWERED_OFF(8) - All VMs of the vApp are powered off.
        INCONSISTENT_STATE(9) (unstable) - Apply to VM status, if a vm is POWERED_ON, or WAITING_FOR_INPUT, but is undeployed, it is in inconsistent state.
        MIXED(10) (unstable) - vApp status is set to MIXED when the VMs in the vApp are in different power states.
        Throws:
        ControlException

      • isVappStatusUnstable

        private Boolean isVappStatusUnstable(com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.Vapp vApp)
        - Control command error handling.

        Helper method to check if the current status of the VApp is considered stable to perform operations.

      • determineStateOfVM

        private ControlModule.ControlStatus determineStateOfVM(ControlModule.ControlAction action,
                                             com.vmware.vcloud.sdk.VM vm)
                                                throws ControlException
        - Control command error handling.

        Method to determine whether the VM is in a state that should be able to process control command requests.

        VM statuses are as below:

        FAILED_CREATION (unstable) - Transient entity state, e.g., model object is created but the corresponding VC backing does not exist yet. This is further sub-categorized in the respective entities.
        UNRESOLVED (unstable) - Entity is whole, e.g., VM creation is complete and all the required model objects and VC backings are created.
        RESOLVED - Entity is resolved.
        SUSPENDED - VM is suspended.
        POWERED_ON - VM is powered on.
        WAITING_FOR_INPUT (unstable) - VM is pending response on a question.
        UNKNOWN (unstable) - Entity state could not be retrieved from the inventory, e.g., VM power state is null.
        UNRECOGNIZED (unstable) - Entity state was retrieved from the inventory but could not be mapped to an internal state.
        POWERED_OFF - VM is powered off.
        INCONSISTENT_STATE (unstable) - If a vm is POWERED_ON, or WAITING_FOR_INPUT, but is undeployed, it is in inconsistent state.
        Parameters:
        action -
        vm -
        Returns:
        Throws:
        ControlException
